title: Wayfair Has Giant Presidents' Day Deals on Small-Space Furniture and Decor
description: Including an editor-favorite "vintage-inspired" rug! READ MORE...
author: Morgan Pryor
text: DecoratingSmall SpacesMorgan PryorCommerce Assistant EditorMorgan PryorCommerce Assistant EditorI cover must-have home products, sales, and brand launches. Prior to working at ATM, I earned my degree in Culture Writing and Criticism from NYU, and I interned at publications like CNN Underscored, TV Insider, Texas Monthly (I'm a Dallas native), and more. When I'm not writing, I'm usually at the movies or browsing in a thrift store.published nowWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Looking for more small-space solutions? Check out our Big Shopping Guide for Small-Space Living, which is packed with our favorite furniture, decor, hacks, and organizing and storage finds for maximizing every inch of every area of your home.As someone who’s lived in small spaces for years — I’m currently in a studio that just barely fits a full-size couch — I can confirm that my apartment is pretty much a constant work in progress. Just when I think that I’ve figured out the best layout or discovered what I think is the perfect item for a particular area, I come across another space-saving find that I swear will be even better. For one, I’m considering swapping out my bulky coffee table for this foldable one from Wayfair. I also ditched my clothes rack for this sleek, narrow Wayfair armoire.Can you see the trend here? It can get pricey making constant upgrades, so I usually turn to Wayfair, with its stylish-yet-affordable lineup of furniture and decor. Thankfully, the retailer has plenty of small space-friendly finds, too, and even better, tons of them are on sale for Presidents’ Day. Since there are hundreds of deals going for as much as 70% off, I’ve rounded up 10 of my favorite finds that’ll help you make the most of your compact space. 1 / 10Wayfair$99.95was $189.00When you land on the right size, color, and pattern, a rug can make a room look so much bigger (and, not to mention, cozier). This one from Joanna Gaines did exactly that in my tiny studio. I can’t get enough of the vintage-inspired pattern and soft feel, and it’s easy to toss into the washing machine for maintenance. (See my full review here.)2 / 10Wayfair$119.99was $239.99If you don’t have room for a full-fledged dining table, you should consider trying out this smaller tulip table. In fact, AT’s senior style editor, Blair, has owned this one for four years. “My living room is tiny and hardly has room for a table at all, but this fits perfectly with two chairs on either side,” she explains. “The round shape helps break up the rest of my boxy furniture, too.”3 / 10Wayfair$162.99was $179.99Another space-efficient find that one of our teammates loves is this table set, which looks way more expensive than it is. “These nesting tables were a great alternative to a bulky coffee table and were the perfect size for my sectional and to open up my living room,” said Katie, AT’s senior director of brand partnerships.4 / 10Wayfair$67.99was $170.00Simply no way to squeeze in a dining table? Wayfair’s got you covered with this C-shaped table, which you can use for dinner and to work from home. It even has built-in storage, which is one of the things commerce editor Britt loves most about it. “Instead of magazines taking over our coffee table, I can keep them on the C table, hidden in plain sight,” she says in her review. “The table moves smoothly between rooms, and it’s surprisingly durable and sturdy, considering I bought it for under $100.”5 / 10Wayfair$141.99was $338.00When deputy commerce editor Alicia visited Wayfair’s showroom in person, she was impressed by this coffee table, which offers plenty of storage. “The rounded edges and rectangular slatted doors are a visually interesting combination that will add more depth to your space,” she says. “I saw the walnut version of this low-profile table in person, and I think it’s one of the more stylish options I viewed in Wayfair’s store.”6 / 10Wayfair$299.99was $1559.96Small-space dwellers know that you can’t allow any area to go to waste, including the real estate underneath your bed. This frame lifts up to reveal a roomy compartment that can hold everything from out-of-season clothes to linens, and the subtle wingback shape and fabric upholstery gives it an elevated appearance.7 / 10Wayfair$187.99was $245.19At only 18 inches wide, this top-rated nightstand will nestle perfectly into that narrow gap next to your bed. Its mid-century modern design goes with pretty much anything, so you can hold onto it even if you switch up your style.8 / 10Wayfair$114.99was $199.99A slim shoe cabinet will instantly declutter your entryway. This one can store up to 20 pairs, with an open shelf on the bottom for your most-worn shoes. There’s also a handy shelf on top where you can put your keys and other everyday essentials.9 / 10Wayfair$759.99was $899.00Another pick from our Personal Shopper series, this sleeper sofa is small with its two-person capacity, but it’ll give your guests a comfortable place to rest. “This writer’s friend also owns this sleeper sofa, which her large dog named Bumi loves to lounge on when it’s in sofa form,” says Alicia. “It has a standard depth and height, which made it comfortable to sit and lounge in.”10 / 10Wayfair$56.99was $61.99Going vertical is crucial in a tiny room or home, and this shelving unit — which comes in at just under 16 inches wide and 74 inches tall — will turn even the narrowest of spaces into ample storage. The open design is perfect for showing off all of your favorite decor and trinkets.Apartment Therapy's Home RunsGet full reviews of editor-favorite finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
html:
• Decorating
  • Small Spaces

Morgan PryorCommerce Assistant Editor

Morgan PryorCommerce Assistant Editor

I cover must-have home products, sales, and brand launches. Prior to working at ATM, I earned my degree in Culture Writing and Criticism from NYU, and I interned at publications like CNN Underscored, TV Insider, Texas Monthly (I'm a Dallas native), and more. When I'm not writing, I'm usually at the movies or browsing in a thrift store.

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Looking for more small-space solutions? Check out our Big Shopping Guide for Small-Space Living, which is packed with our favorite furniture, decor, hacks, and organizing and storage finds for maximizing every inch of every area of your home.

As someone who’s lived in small spaces for years — I’m currently in a studio that just barely fits a full-size couch — I can confirm that my apartment is pretty much a constant work in progress. Just when I think that I’ve figured out the best layout or discovered what I think is the perfect item for a particular area, I come across another space-saving find that I swear will be even better. For one, I’m considering swapping out my bulky coffee table for this foldable one from Wayfair. I also ditched my clothes rack for this sleek, narrow Wayfair armoire.

Can you see the trend here? It can get pricey making constant upgrades, so I usually turn to Wayfair, with its stylish-yet-affordable lineup of furniture and decor. Thankfully, the retailer has plenty of small space-friendly finds, too, and even better, tons of them are on sale for Presidents’ Day. Since there are hundreds of deals going for as much as 70% off, I’ve rounded up 10 of my favorite finds that’ll help you make the most of your compact space. 

1 / 10

Wayfair

$99.95

was $189.00

When you land on the right size, color, and pattern, a rug can make a room look so much bigger (and, not to mention, cozier). This one from Joanna Gaines did exactly that in my tiny studio. I can’t get enough of the vintage-inspired pattern and soft feel, and it’s easy to toss into the washing machine for maintenance. (See my full review here.)

2 / 10

Wayfair

$119.99

was $239.99

If you don’t have room for a full-fledged dining table, you should consider trying out this smaller tulip table. In fact, AT’s senior style editor, Blair, has owned this one for four years. “My living room is tiny and hardly has room for a table at all, but this fits perfectly with two chairs on either side,” she explains. “The round shape helps break up the rest of my boxy furniture, too.”

3 / 10

Wayfair

$162.99

was $179.99

Another space-efficient find that one of our teammates loves is this table set, which looks way more expensive than it is. “These nesting tables were a great alternative to a bulky coffee table and were the perfect size for my sectional and to open up my living room,” said Katie, AT’s senior director of brand partnerships.

4 / 10

Wayfair

$67.99

was $170.00

Simply no way to squeeze in a dining table? Wayfair’s got you covered with this C-shaped table, which you can use for dinner and to work from home. It even has built-in storage, which is one of the things commerce editor Britt loves most about it. “Instead of magazines taking over our coffee table, I can keep them on the C table, hidden in plain sight,” she says in her review. “The table moves smoothly between rooms, and it’s surprisingly durable and sturdy, considering I bought it for under $100.”

5 / 10

Wayfair

$141.99

was $338.00

When deputy commerce editor Alicia visited Wayfair’s showroom in person, she was impressed by this coffee table, which offers plenty of storage. “The rounded edges and rectangular slatted doors are a visually interesting combination that will add more depth to your space,” she says. “I saw the walnut version of this low-profile table in person, and I think it’s one of the more stylish options I viewed in Wayfair’s store.”

6 / 10

Wayfair

$299.99

was $1559.96

Small-space dwellers know that you can’t allow any area to go to waste, including the real estate underneath your bed. This frame lifts up to reveal a roomy compartment that can hold everything from out-of-season clothes to linens, and the subtle wingback shape and fabric upholstery gives it an elevated appearance.

7 / 10

Wayfair

$187.99

was $245.19

At only 18 inches wide, this top-rated nightstand will nestle perfectly into that narrow gap next to your bed. Its mid-century modern design goes with pretty much anything, so you can hold onto it even if you switch up your style.

8 / 10

Wayfair

$114.99

was $199.99

A slim shoe cabinet will instantly declutter your entryway. This one can store up to 20 pairs, with an open shelf on the bottom for your most-worn shoes. There’s also a handy shelf on top where you can put your keys and other everyday essentials.

9 / 10

Wayfair

$759.99

was $899.00

Another pick from our Personal Shopper series, this sleeper sofa is small with its two-person capacity, but it’ll give your guests a comfortable place to rest. “This writer’s friend also owns this sleeper sofa, which her large dog named Bumi loves to lounge on when it’s in sofa form,” says Alicia. “It has a standard depth and height, which made it comfortable to sit and lounge in.”

10 / 10

Wayfair

$56.99

was $61.99

Going vertical is crucial in a tiny room or home, and this shelving unit — which comes in at just under 16 inches wide and 74 inches tall — will turn even the narrowest of spaces into ample storage. The open design is perfect for showing off all of your favorite decor and trinkets.

Get full reviews of editor-favorite finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
